product_name: Voile Switchback X2 Telemark Touring Bindings - Short
long_description: The short Voile Switchback X2 telemark touring bindings have a powerful feel designed to meet the demands of modern backcountry skiers who wear 4-buckle boots and ride on fat skis. Compared with original Voile Switchback bindings, the X2 bindings feature 25% stiffer cartridges and pivot points that have been moved back 1.125 in. for increased power. Bindings let you easily switch between free-pivot touring mode and downhill telemark mode with the use of a ski pole. Free-pivot mechanism is designed to resist ice and snow buildup for hassle-free touring. Weighing in at 3 lbs. 3 oz. per pair, the X2 bindings are the second lightest free-pivot bindings on the market (behind only the original Voile Switchback). Full wraparound stainless-steel toe plates stand up to regular backcountry use. Include 2 climbing wires that lift your heels 65mm and 100mm to take the strain of your legs while skinning up hills. Spinning spring cartridges allow easy length adjustments; stainless-steel hooks and rods add strength and durability. Voile Switchback X2 telemark touring bindings with short-length rods fit boot sizes 24 - 26.5 mondo.
short_description: The short Voile Switchback X2 telemark touring bindings have a powerful feel designed to meet the demands of modern backcountry skiers who wear 4-buckle boots and ride on fat skis.
